comments.body: What is a MPC and why would they be cool to have in the game?

Not a big fan of most of your ideas, but this is your best one, especially because Soul Sand could definitely use something to make it scarier and more dangerous. And it fits because it's like one of the souls came to life..... :P

I do think you could find a better name than Wheezer - maybe something like Wandering Soul? I also think it should be faster than a zombie, otherwise it will be too easy to defeat. The blindness is a neat idea for sure, and so is the Slow Falling.

Last thing: about how rare are you talking here? As rare as a Wither Skeleton? Baby zombie?

By the way, thanks for leaving such a nice comment on my Reform of the Beacons post the other day, ProfFox101. You should consider reading my other posts if you liked it!

Thanks MacchuPicchu96!

btw i want it to be easy to defeat like a Zombie, so it can be just a random nuisance (lol)
No problem ProfFox101! Nice edits btw. And the "random nuisance" makes sense, too. I like it
Could be good
Totally! It would also be cool for them to hide in logs / moss!
I want multiple different models / shapes it can spawn in. Maybe it could sometimes freeze in cool poses too, hehe

hmm. sounds good. we should be able to tame it and do falcolnry.

It would be perfect considering they added the mangrove biome the number 1 most fitting perfect biome for a crocodile to be in anyways the mangrove doesn‚Äôt have much other than the frog. Not just that the crocodile could go in different biome such as the swamp‚Äô large rivers in the jungle and large rivers in the desert and could have regional color and size variants with the ones spawning in the mangroves the largest and dark colored and the desert second largest and lighter. Its perfect for minecraft with the mangroves added

This would make swamps, mangroves and maybe jungles and desserts? A lot more interesting and dangerous as it would keep players on their toes during daytime as well as night time. Perhaps crocodiles could be hostile and if slain could drop scales which could be used to craft armour or maybe used in potions and maybe even teeth which could be used in crafting weapons or tools or etc. However, I know Mojang and Microsoft don‚Äôt like adding endangered animals that drop loot to the game so perhaps they could be passive. Although in my opinion this doesn‚Äôt really fit our perception of them so maybe a mob that looks and acts similarly to crocodiles could be added with a sort of ‚Äúmythical spin‚Äù that separates them from regular crocodiles. You could have different varieties like saltwater crocodiles in dessert rivers and maybe oasis‚Äôs if they could also be added to the game you could also have a size range that includes dwarf caimans going all the way up to the giant crocodiles found in the nile and Australia etc. you could also possibly add alligators as a further example of bio-diversity.
Great idea I posted something like this too. Keep that smart brain there!

To add onto this- they could be neutral mobs. Or, hostile mobs, but they don't seek out the player. They stay in one spot (near the water or in it) and will snap at the player if interacted with, but not actively hostile. Maybe they could feed on turtles and any mobs that get too close. Could be a good way to farm mob loot, although the crocodiles themselves wouldn't drop much other than EXP. Might be hard to kill, too, just to discourage players from messing with them.

i aggree they should add a variation of foxes that spawn in dessert's! so that we have a fox in taiga, snowy taiga and The desserts! they should eat the local bunnies :)
I like it! But you should have to hit the killer whales to be hostile .

Killer whales are a kind of dolphin, and a such are horrible creatures that will torture seals to death and not even eat them, or surgically remove a shark's liver, eat it, and leave the rest of the shark to die a painful death and rot. Also, they have been recorded to eat people. 

Whales, such as the blue whale, are compassionate, beautiful, majestic creatures, that will rescue baby seals from orcas by flipping upside down and allowing the seal to climb on top of them. Unlike dolphins, they do this for no benefit to themselves, simply out of the kindness of their hearts. Like basking sharks, they do not eat fish, and will simply feed on plankton. If they sink your boat, it is by accident. They can't help it if they create wakes that can capsize ships just by swimming by, or can accidentally sink our ships by breaching (jumping out of the water) to say hello, or if their farts are so big they can sink ships...

Whales deserve to be in Minecraft, the racist, capitalist, psychopathic, drunkard, attention-hogging mini-whales that are called dolphins do not. (this is based mainly on second-hand (or third-hand) accounts of scientific fact.)
The tamed whales allow to build on a little house, and the player move with him.
I get if the Developers believe this is insane. Its just me and my friends have wanted this for as long as we've played minecraft

Hmmmm, it might replace stray cats tho so maybe give an a different purpose like the  ability to kill phantoms? I do agree that ocelots should be useful tho

I feel like this would make sense. Currently, we know Creepers are afraid of cats and ocelots, but we don't really have a reason as to WHY that is. Having it so ocelots attack Creepers would not only give them an actual use and a reason for players to gain their trust, but would also provide an in-game explanation as to why Creepers are afraid of ocelots, and by extension cats since they're a close relative.
